Comments/ Action Taken: Cases reported from Village Phullen. State RRT investigated the outbreak. Since August 2017 to January 2018, a total of 81 cases and 1 death were reported from the affected area. A total of 4 villages were affected; Village Phullen (54 cases & 1 death), Thanglailung (5 cases), Luangpawn (20 cases) and Zawngin (2 cases). An increase in number of cases was observed in the month of December 2017 (40 cases, December 17 and 10 cases in Jan 2018). Eschar manifestation were not reportedly observed among the cases. Environmental studies were conducted and rodent infestations were observed in the surveyed area. All cases were treated and cases were followed up at their houses. All the 81 samples were tested by Rapid Test kits (SD Bioline, Tsutsugamushi kit). Health awareness campaign regarding scrub typhus was organized at Community Hall, Phullen.

Cases reported District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Out of 430 blood samples collected; 195 samples were positive for scrub typhus (SD Biolinefrom Village/PHC Haulawng. Tsutsugamushi) rapid

Cases reported from several PHC Kosapalayam BL & dt-Puducherry, Mettupalayam Oulgaret, Koodapakkam, Sorapet, Thirukannur and Thirubhuvanai. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Out of 45 samples collected at SRL, IGMCRI Puducherry, 06 samples were positive for Scrub typhus. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Casesreported from Village Subashnagar, HC Karikalam Pakkum Block Bahour. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Out of 37 samples collected and tested at SRL, IGMCRI Puducherry; 11samples were found positive for Scrub typhus (IgM ELISA). Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Sedarapet , PHC -Muthialpet,, CHC Raddiyarpalayam, Block Pudicheery +(Village/CHC Villianu. PHCs - Sodarapet, Block Pudicheery.). District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 53 samples collected at IGMCRI Puducherry result 06 samples positive for Igm ab for Scrub Typhus. RRT ls taking all necessary steps to diagnosis any fresh cases and also taking all corrective measures. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.
reported from PHCMuthialpet symptomatically. Health educationKosapalyam,

Cases of fever reported from Village/SC Langol Tarung and Langol, Imphal West. Block Haorangsabal, PHC Khurkhul. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 12 Blood samples sent to Babina Diagnostic Centre, RIMS Road and SRL, IDSP, JNIMS; 03 samples were positive for scrub typhus. All cases treated symptomatically. Relevant health education given.

Cases of fever with body ache reported from Village Pangzawl PHC. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. 387 blood samples tested at Pangzawl PHC; 107 samples found positive for scrub typhus. 41 blood samples collected for re- test (Weil Felix test) at Civil Hospital Lunglei; result awaited. All cases treated with Tab Doxycycline. Health education given for use of personal protection measures.

Cases reported from Village/SC Sawleng, PHC/Block Darlawn. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 254 serum samples tested for scrub typhus at Darlawn PHC; 79 samples were positive. All cases treated with Doxycyclin. Relevant health education given.

A total of 63 cases and 6 deaths of scrub typhus reported from Nagpur urban and rural area during 6th August to 11th November 2018. Apart from Nagpur District cases were reported from Amravati District and many bordering Districts of Madhya Pradesh like Balaghat, Chindwara, Umaria, Seoni, Betul and Satna. A total of 78 cases and 14 deaths were reported from 1st August to 7th September 2018. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All the cases were treated at GMC, Nagapur. Entomological survey done and vector control measures like malathion dusting was undertaken in the affected areas. Health education given regarding personal protection measures.

Cases reported from Village Patrabori and Torabori, Block Laharighat and Bhurbandha, District Marigaon. Cases presented with fever and jaundice. Serum sample were sent to GMCH. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Result came positive for the Scrub typhus IgM by ELISA. Door to door survey was done. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral health team on vector control measures and sanitation.

Cases reported from Village Patrabori and Torabori, Block Laharighat and Bhurbandha, District Marigaon. Cases presented with fever and jaundice. Serum sample were sent to GMCH. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Result came positive for the Scrub typhus IgM by ELISA. Door to door survey was done. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral health team on vector control measures and sanitation.

Cases reported from Hakikat Nagar and Shastri Nagar of UPHC Vasant Vihar and UPHC Shiv Colony, Karnal. Cases presented with Fever, Lower abdomen pain and Breathlessness. 58 Blood samples (28 symptomatic + 30 contacts) were collected and tested at DPHL Karnal for Scrub Typhus IgM Antibody. 2 male and 7 female cases were reported positive. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral health team on VBD. IEC Activity & creating awareness was conducted in the community. House to House survey was conducted. Blood Samples of contacts of suspected patients for scrub typhus were taken. Fogging and entomological surveillance was done.

Cases of fever reported from Village Haibatpur, PHC Vaina, District Ballia. Out of 14 blood samples collected and sent to District Sentinel lab Balia, 4 samples tested positive for Orientia tsutsugamushi (IgM ELISA). District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey was done. A health camp was organized in the affected area. Cases treated symptomatically. IEC activities regarding personal hygiene and sanitation practices done.

Cases were reported from Village Sango, Sub- District Leporiang Circle, District Papum Pare. Cases presented with high grade fever, vomiting and loss of appetite. 7 Blood samples were found to be positive for Scrub Typhus (Tsutsugamushi) IgM & IgG by Card test at CHC Sagalee, Papumpare. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases were treated symptomatically. Affected age group was 25- 50 years. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on vector control measures, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases were reported from Dudungkhar and Lumla area, Sub-District Lumla District Tawang. Cases presented with high grade fever, body ache, restlessness. 3 Blood samples were sent toKDS District Hospital, Tawang. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases were treated symptomatically. All 3 samples came positive for IgM Scrub Typhus by ELISA. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on vector control measures, hygiene and sanitation. Two cases 38-year-old female (Shayro Village) and 52-year-old female (Muktor Village) succumbed to death.

Cases were reported from Village Sango, Sub- District Leporiang Circle, District Papum Pare. Cases presented with high grade fever, vomiting and loss of appetite. 7 Blood samples were found to be positive for Scrub Typhus (Tsutsugamushi) IgM & IgG by Card test at CHC Sagalee, Papumpare. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases were treated symptomatically. Affected age group was 25- 50 years. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on vector control measures, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases were reported from Dudungkhar and Lumla area, Sub-District Lumla District Tawang. Cases presented with high grade fever, body ache, restlessness. 3 Blood samples were sent toKDS District Hospital, Tawang. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases were treated symptomatically. All 3 samples came positive for IgM Scrub Typhus by ELISA. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on vector control measures, hygiene and sanitation. Two cases 38-year-old female (Shayro Village) and 52-year-old female (Muktor Village) succumbed to death.

Cases reported from village Tala and surrounding villages of Amarpatan block. Cases presented with Undifferentiated fever with chills, headache. The affected age group was 0-70 years. 22 Serum samples were sent to AIIMS Bhopal lab, out of which 13 were found to be positive for Orientia tsutsugamushi by IgM ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral health team on scrub typhus. Active surveillance was done. Cutting of grasses was done. Malathion powder was sprayed. Insecticidal spray were done in the houses up to 2 feet on the walls as preventive a measure. House-to-house fever survey was done.

Cases Reported from At. /Po. Ganpur, PHC Konsari, Taluk Chamorshi & At. Ajantola, Waadegaon, PHC Deulgaon, Taluka Kurkheda. Cases presented with symptoms of Fever with chills, itching and pain in wound site. 2 serum samples were sent to VRDL AIIMS Nagpur, both were found to be positive for scrub typhus by IgM ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral health team on scrub typhus. Active surveillance was done. Cutting of grasses was done. Malathion powder was sprayed.

Cases reported from Lungleng Village under Hlimen UPHC. Cases presented with symptoms of Headache, Fever, and Nausea. 46 Serum samples were tested with Weil Felix on site by RRT, out of which 28 samples were found to be Weil Felix positive for scrub typhus. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral health team on scrub typhus.

Cases reported from Village Khejuri, Block Panda, Sub District Sikanderpur, District Ballia. Cases presented with fever. Out of 27 blood samples collected and sent to District Sentinel Lab, Ballia, 6 samples tested positive for Orientia tsutsugamushi (IgM ELISA). District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral health team on Scrub Typhus. House to house fever survey was done. Cases were treated at a health camp organized in the affected area. IEC activities regarding personal hygiene and sanitation were done.

Case was reported from Gigasan Vadi vistar, Taluk Dhari, near Gir Forest. Case admitted to Civil Hospital, Ahmedabad with symptoms of fever, chills and swelling in leg and dark scab on both legs. Blood Sample was sent to Civil Hospital lab, Ahmedabad, which was found to be Positive for Scrub Typhus by IgM ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral health team on personal and professional hygiene and safe drinking water. House to House survey was done and close contacts were detected during Contact Tracing, all were found to be asymptomatic.

Cases were reported from Village Khardhamnia, Sub-District Suwasara, District Mandsaur. Cases presented with fever with body ache. Total 45 blood samples sent to AIIMS Bhopal. District RRT investigated the outbreak. 9 samples came positive for Scrub typhus IgM by ELISA. Cases were treated symptomatically. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on vector control measures, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases were reported from Sub-District Malpura, District Tonk. Cases presented with fever. 98 samples were collected. 80 samples were sent to District Sahadat Hospital Tonk and 18 samples were sent to SMS lab. District RRT investigated the outbreak. 14 out of 98 samples were found positive for Scrub typhus IgM by ELISA. Cases were treated symptomatically. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on vector control measures, hygiene and sanitation. 32- year-old male succumbed to death due to previous co morbid conditions.

Cases were reported from Village Gahlai, Sub-District Mariahu, District Jaunpur. Cases presented with fever. 13 blood samples collected and sent to IMS-BHU. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Three out of 13 samples found positive for Scrub typhus IgM by ELISA. Cases were treated symptomatically. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on vector control measures, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases of fever were reported from Village Salamatpur, CHC Naupedwa, District Jaunpur. Out of 9 blood samples collected and sent to IMS-BHU, 1 sample tested positive for Orientia tsutsugamushi (IgM ELISA). District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. Cases treated at a health camp organized in the affected area. IEC activities regarding personal hygiene and sanitation practices done. Environmental control measures undertaken in the affected area.

Cases were reported from Village Khamkheda Baijnath, Sub-District Ashta, District Sehore. Cases presented with fever with rash. 6 blood samples were collected and sent to AIIMS Bhopal. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases were treated symptomatically. 1 out of 6 blood samples came positive for Scrub typhus IgM by ELISA. Age group of the affected cases were 5-70 years. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on hygiene and sanitation.

Cases reported Dahelitanda. Cases presented with symptoms of fever. Total 10 serum samples were collected and sent to Nagpur GMC, out of which 1 sample was found to be positive for scrub typus by Rapid Diagnostic Test. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral health team on scrub typhus. Active surveillance was done. Tick surveillance was done throughout the village.from Village Bhumpur, SC Dundra, PHC

Cases were reported from Sanjivani Baba Nagar, District: Bhopal. Cases presented with symptoms of fever. Serological sample for IgM Elisa test was taken of 2 cases and sent to AIIMS Bhopal, which were came positive for IgM by ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral health team on scrub typhus. Active surveillance was done. House to house survey was done.

Cases Reported from Ghogli, Block Kamptee, PHC Gumthi & Sub Centre Gumthala. Cases presented with symptoms of fever. Total 3 samples were collected & sent to AIIMS Nagpur, all 3 samples were negative for IgM ELISA for Scrub Typhus. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral health team on dengue. Fever and container survey were conducted in the area and surrounding areas, and preventive and curative measures were taken. Daily entomological surveys were conducted. Fogging, source reduction were done. Death of a 64 year old female has occurred due to the illness (Scrub Typhus IgM ELISA positive).

Cases were reported from various hospitals in Naharlagun and Itanagar during the period August to December. District Papum Pare. Cases presented with fever, headache and myalgia. Total 722 blood samples were collected and sent to DPHL Naharlagun and TRIHMS. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases were treated symptomatically. Total 34 samples came positive for Scrub typhus IgM by ELISA. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on vector control measures, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases were reported from Nonglang PHC under Mawthadraishan, District West Khasi Hills. Cases presented with fever, headache and bodyache. 17 serum samples and were collected and sent to Pasteur Institute Molecular Diagnostic Lab. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases were treated with antibiotics and other supportive measures. 8 samples found positive for Scrub typhus IgM by ELISA. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on rodent control measures, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases of fever, cough, epistaxis, conjunctival congestion and skin rash reported from Village Hojai Dobongling, SC Thanalambra, PHC Gunjung, BPHC Gunjung. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Serum samples collected and sent to microbiology department GMCH. All samples tested negative for dengue IgM ELISA. 2 samples tested positive for Scrub Typhus IgM ELISA. All blood smears were found to be negative for malaria. All cases treated locally. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Nacho PHC, District Upper Subansiri, District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 04 serum samples collected and sent to DPHL Naharlagun; result awaited. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Chittiambakkam, HSC Rajakulam, PHC Parandur, Block Walajabad. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. All blood smears tested negative for malaria parasite.6 serum samples tested at KIPM; 1 sample tested positive for Scrub typhus, 2 samples were found to be equivocal for leptospirosis.All cases treated symptomatically. Fogging done in the area. Health education given.

Cases of fever with uneasiness & breathlessness reported from Village Borgaon, PHC DhapewadaTalkalmeshwar. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All 04 samples sent to NCDC New Delhi for Weil-Felix &IgM ELISA test for Scrub Typhus were found to be positive. All cases treated locally. Health education given.

Cases reported from different villages under Khliehriet CHC. District. RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done.48 blood samples tested positive for Scrub Typhus by Weil Felix test at CHC Khliehriet. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Samtlang. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Out of 32 samples collected and tested at DPHL Aizwal and 25 positive by ELISA test. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.
Cases reported from Village/CHC Thenzawl. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House Medical camps were organized at Thenzawl CHC. Out of 62 samples tested at RMRC Dibrugarh and 17 samples was

Cases reported from Village Mon, Block Aboi. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 08 blood samples collected; were positive for scrub typhus (Weil - Felix Agglutination test). All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Angkaling, under CHC Kalaktang, Block Kalaktang. District RRT investigated the outbreak. 3 blood samples collected and confirmed positive for Scrub Typhus by Immuno Chromatographic Assay Rapid Test at CHC Kalaktang. Cases reported with fever, chills, and headache. Typical eschar/lesion observed under arms. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Angkaling, under CHC Kalaktang, Block Kalaktang. District RRT investigated the outbreak. 3 blood samples collected and confirmed positive for Scrub Typhus by Immuno Chromatographic Assay Rapid Test at CHC Kalaktang. Cases reported with fever, chills, and headache. Typical eschar/lesion observed under arms. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Makhibaha, Village Milanpur, Village/SC Borajol, Village Kakaya. All affected were adults. All had fever, headache, body ache, gastrointestinal pain and chest pain. No eschar or change in mental status was observed. There was no travel history. No contact with cattle or pets. 4 blood samples collected and sent to DPHL, SMK Civil Hospital, Nalbari and all found positive. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

RRT investigated at RMRC-ICMR, Dibrugarh. All cases given.Cases reported from various villages of East Siang. District the outbreak. 18 blood samples were collected and all found positive for Scrub Typhus and tested treated education

Cases reported from Ghalwad, SC Kutwad, PHC Ghalwad, Block Shirol. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Affected area is a remote place and having cattle sheds in all around in the area. Sanitation was poor. 03 blood serum samples collected and tested positive for Scrub typhus by Weil Felix test. House to house survey done. All cases treated. Health education given. Antimite dusting was done in the area along with the management of shrubs.

Case reported from Village Bohuabheti, SC/PHC Kasamari, Block Buragohaithan. District RRT investigated the outbreak. A 45 year old female presented in a semiconscious state with fever, vomiting and pain abdomen in a K/C/O hypetension and stroke. The patient expired at home after discharge against medical advice. Serum sample was collected and sent to DPHL, Nagaon, and reported negative for Japanese Encephalitis and positive for Scrub Typhus. Fever survey conducted in the affected area. Health education given.

Case reported from Village Bohuabheti, SC/PHC Kasamari, Block Buragohaithan. District RRT investigated the outbreak. A 45 year old female presented in a semiconscious state with fever, vomiting and pain abdomen in a K/C/O hypetension and stroke. The patient expired at home after discharge against medical advice. Serum sample was collected and sent to DPHL, Nagaon, and reported negative for Japanese Encephalitis and positive for Scrub Typhus. Fever survey conducted in the affected area. Health education given.

Cases reported from various places in Sonitpur. District RRT investigated the outbreak. All cases were first diagnosed as Acute encephalitis Syndrome. Serum samples of all 33 cases collected sent to Apex laboratory at RMRC Dibrugarh, result of all samples reported positive for Scrub Typhus. A total of 06 individuals’ succumbed to death. Deaths are being reported since the 7th of April, 2019. The details of the death cases is presented in tabular form:

Cases reported from Village Parsi Parlo, CHC Koloriang, Block Koloriang, Kurung. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Most affected cases were children, residing in jungle area and with unhygienic lifestyle. The deceased were in the age group 1-6 years. A total of 05 blood samples were collected and tested at DPHL, TRIHMS; 04 found Equivocal for Scrub typhus (IgM ELISA). All cases were treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Parsi Parlo, CHC Koloriang, Block Koloriang, Kurung. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Most affected cases were children, residing in jungle area and with unhygienic lifestyle. The deceased were in the age group 1-6 years. A total of 05 blood samples were collected and tested at DPHL, TRIHMS; 04 found Equivocal for Scrub typhus (IgM ELISA). All cases were treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Deoli, PHC Muradgaon, Deoli Ward No 6. District RRT investigated the outbreak. A total of 06 serum samples collected and tested at MGIMS Sevagram Medical College; result awaited. All cases were treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from West, Churachandpur, Kakching, Senapati & Bishnupur. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Out of 34 blood samples collected and sent to RIMS for 06 found positive for Scrub Typhus. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Cheural, SC Cheural PHC Sangau, Block Sangau. District RRT investigated the outbreak. The deceased were 60y/M and 22y/F. Cases presented with fever and headache. A total of 208 samples collected and tested; 101 samples positive for Scrub typhus by Weil Felix test. All cases treated. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village/SC Cheural, PHC/Block Sangau. District RRT investigated the outbreak. A total of 127 samples collected and sent to ICMR Dibrugarh, result awaited. All cases treated. Health education given.

Cases of fever with chills, myalgia, and headache reported from Village Kurikota, PHC Mahagoan, Block Gulbarga, District Gulbarga. Medical team investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All cases treated locally. 8 serum samples collected were negative for Dengue. Out of 8 serum samples collected, 4 serum samples were positive for Weil Felix test. Health education given.

Cases of fever with chills, myalgia, headache, cough, malaise reported from Villages Angkaling, Denzi and Samphung, Block Kalaktang, District West Kameng. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active search for cases done. Cases were clustered in the locality. Blood samples collected; result awaited. Capsule Doxycycline given to all affected persons.

Name of District: Jaipur Alwar, Dausa, Karauli and districts
Comments/ Action Taken: Cases of fever with chills, myalgia and headache reported from District Jaipur Alwar, Karauli, Dausa and several Districts of Rajasthan. District RRT investigated the outbreak. A total of 357 cases and 8 deaths were reported during 31st July to 30 September 2013. Majorly affected district were Jaipur (110 cases, 3 deaths), Alwar (79 cases, 1 death), Karauli (51 cases), Dausa (48 cases, 4 deaths), Bharatpur (27cases). All cases treated. Medical teams sent for treatment of cases. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village- Sathangudi, HSC- Agarathur, PHC-Kothangudi, Block- Kumbakonam, District- Thanjavur. Cases presented with fever and body pain. Three water and seven blood samples were sent to DPHL Thanjavur. Out of seven blood samples, four were found positive for Scrub typhus by IgM ELISA and one sample was found positive for Dengue by IgM ELISA. Water sample was found to be non-potable. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Door to door surveillance was done,

Cases reported from District hospital raga Kamle District. Cases presented with high fever of more than 5 days with eschar and enlarged lymph node, lethargy and loss of appetite. Four blood samples were collected and sent to district hospital Raga Lab and were found positive by Rapid antigen test for Scrub typhus.

Cases reported from District hospital raga Kamle District. Cases presented with high fever of more than 5 days with eschar and enlarged lymph node, lethargy and loss of appetite. Four blood samples were collected and sent to district hospital Raga Lab and were found positive by Rapid antigen test for Scrub typhus.

Cases reported to Ghughra CHC, Pahadi, Katni, presented with symptoms like fever, joint pain. Eight blood samples were sent to Nirth Jabalpur, where one tested positive for scrub typhus by IgM ELISA. District RRT team formed and rapid fever survey of complete village was done. Villagers were educated regarding disease and their prevention. Health workers were educated regarding the identification of cases and raising awareness regarding scrub typhus.

Cases presented with symptoms of fever and black eschar from Village Poniya Sec. Poniya Block Bijadandi. Five blood sample collected and sent to AIIMS Bhopal through DPHL Lab Jabalpur where one sample was found positive for IgM antibodies to Orientia tsutsugamushi. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Case treated symptomatically, Door to Door Fever Survey Done, Insecticide Spray has been done inside and outside of houses including bushes, Health Education given and IEC activities done.

Cases presented with fever and rash. Out of 11 samples, seven tested positive for Scrub Typhus and five positive for leptospirosis from KGMU Lucknow. Eight followup samples sent to KGMU, where all tested postive for both scrub typhus and leptospirosis. Specific treatment given to all patients and prophylactic treatment to their contacts. Rodent control measures were undertaken and cutting of bushes around the affected patients area was done. Miking & drum beating for awareness was done.

Cases reported from Appapuram village, PHC Laveru, Laveru Mandalam, Srikakulam district. Cases presented with fever and abdominal pain. Seven blood samples were sent to Regional lab SVIMS Tirupati. Of these, four samples were found to be positive for Scrub typhus by IgM ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Prophylactic treatment with Cap. Doxycycline was given to all the adults. Prophylactic treatment with Tab. Azithromycin was given to all children aged below 10 years, to pregnant women and lactating mothers. Health education was given. Door to door fever surveillance was done.

Cases reported from Murmadi Tup Health facility, Subdistrict Lakhani, District Bhandara. Cases presented with fever, chest pain, breathlessness and altered sensorium. One blood sample was sent to Shree Pathology & Microbiology Lab, Bhandara and found positive for Scrub typhus by IgM ELISA. The deceased case was a 73 years old female. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active case search was done and all fever cases were managed as per protocol. Health education was given.

Cases reported from village Arajpuri and Bhimdo, Block- Dondilohara with fever. Two serum sample collected and sent to AIIMS Raipur which is found positive for Scrub typhus. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given. Door to door survey done.

Cases reported from Village Dulbari under Panchmile NPHC, Bihaguri BPHC and from Anjalipara village Ward No. 10 and Dhekiajuli TE, under Batasipur subcentre, Dhekiajuli BPHC. District RRT visited the affected area and investigated the outbreak. 12 sera samples collected by Baptist Christian Hospital, Mission Chariali, Tezpur and sent to RMRC, Dibrugarh; out of these four samples tested positive for Scrub Typhus.

Cases of fever with chills, myalgia, reported from PHC Shangpung, CHC Laskein, District Jaintia Hills. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active search for cases done. Out of 150 blood samples collected, 72 samples were positive for Scrub Typhus. All cases treated. IEC done.

Cases reported from Village Vinobaji Colony & Madurai Veeran Street, SC Melachokkanathapuram, PHC Silamarathupatti, Block Bodinayakanur, District Theni. 6 serum samples sent to DPHL Theni, 2 samples tested positive for Leptospirosis and Scrubtyphius and 3 samples positive for Scrub Typhus. Source reduction and fogging carried out. IEC done regarding personal protective measures.
Cases reported from Ukhrul District Hospital, District Ukhrul. A total of 05 serum samples were tested out of which 02 were positive for Scrub Typhus. IEC was done on prevention of Scrub Typhus.

Cases reported from different villages of Tobu area under Mon District. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Out of 256 samples tested at District Hospital Mon, 100 were found to be positive for scrub typhus. Control measures taken. Health education given.

The deceased was a 38 year old male who reported from Village Chaikyagaon, SC Forest village, Block PHC Naharani. Case presented with fever, headache, abdomen pain and jaundice. 11 Serum samples were collected and sent for investigation out of which 03 tested positive for Scrub Typhus by IgM ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given.
Cases reported from Village Khalihamari, SC Ghuguha, PHC Batgharia, BPHC Dhemaji. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given.

The deceased was a 38 year old male who reported from Village Chaikyagaon, SC Forest village, Block PHC Naharani. Case presented with fever, headache, abdomen pain and jaundice. 11 Serum samples were collected and sent for investigation out of which 03 tested positive for Scrub Typhus by IgM ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given.
Cases reported from Village Khalihamari, SC Ghuguha, PHC Batgharia, BPHC Dhemaji. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given.

Case was reported from Village Dolohat Bazar, SC Dolohat, BPHC Nowboicha. Case presented with Abdominal pain and weakness. Blood sample was collected and it tested positive for Scrub Typhus by IgM ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given.

Case was reported from Village Dolohat Bazar, SC Dolohat, BPHC Nowboicha. Case presented with Abdominal pain and weakness. Blood sample was collected and it tested positive for Scrub Typhus by IgM ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given.

Cases reported from Village Pathalial, SC/PHC Machkhowa, BPHC Benegenagorah. The case presented with fever and headache. Blood sample was sent to AMCH, Dibrugarh and result was positive for Scrub Typhus by IgM ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given.

Case reported from Village–Tengabari, SC & PHC– Chimenmukh, BPHC–Sissiborgaon. Case presented with fever, bodyache, swelling of the lower limbs and weakness. Serum sample was sent for further lab analysis, it tested positive for Scrub Typhus by IgM ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given.

Case reported from Village–Tengabari, SC & PHC– Chimenmukh, BPHC–Sissiborgaon. Case presented with fever, bodyache, swelling of the lower limbs and weakness. Serum sample was sent for further lab analysis, it tested positive for Scrub Typhus by IgM ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given.

Case reported from Village–Jalaji,SHC–Ramhari, Saloipara. Case presented with fever, rashes and headache after taking vaccination of COVID. One blood sample was sent for lab analysis to GMCH and was found positive for Scrub Typhus by IgM ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given.

Case reported from Village–Jalaji,SHC–Ramhari, Saloipara. Case presented with fever, rashes and headache after taking vaccination of COVID. One blood sample was sent for lab analysis to GMCH and was found positive for Scrub Typhus by IgM ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given.

Cases reported from Barwadih, District Latehar. Cases presented with fever. 20 samples were sent to RIMS, Ranchi and out of which eight were positive for Scrub Typhus by IgM ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak and appropriate actions were taken. Health education was given.

Case reported from Village Karunabari No-1, SC Laluk Model Hospital (N), BPHC Bihpuria, District Lakhimpur. The case presented with fever, cough and vomiting. Blood sample was sent to AMCH, Dibrugarh and result was found positive for Scrub Typhus by IgM ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was

Case reported from Village/SC Sollong 1-no Gorubandha, BPHC Jakhalabandha, PHC Naltoli MPHC, District Nagaon. Case presented with fever and headache. CSF sample was sent for lab analysis to GMCH, Guwahati. Sample was found positive for Scrub Typhus by IgM ELISA in GMCH, Guwahati. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given.

Case reported from Village/SC Sollong 1-no Gorubandha, BPHC Jakhalabandha, PHC Naltoli MPHC, District Nagaon. Case presented with fever and headache. CSF sample was sent for lab analysis to GMCH, Guwahati. Sample was found positive for Scrub Typhus by IgM ELISA in GMCH, Guwahati. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given.

Cases reported from Block Bisrakh, SC Barola, Village Nagali Vazid Pur, Block Bisrakh, SC Chhaproli, Village Nagli, Block Dadri, SC Amka, Village Roopwas, District Gautam Budha Nagar. Three samples were sent for further lab analysis, out of which all three tested positive for Scrub typhus by IgM ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given.

Cases reported from Village/SC Khursa, PHC Amirza, Block/District Gadchiroli. 18 Serum samples were sent to IGMC Nagpur for further lab analysis, out of which seven samples were found to be positive for Scrub Typhus by IgM ELISA. The deceased case was a 41 year old female. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given.

Case reported from Village/SC Bherbheribill, PHC Kharupetia, District Darrang (Mangaldoi). Blood sample was sent for lab analysis to TMCH. It was found positive for Scrub Typhus by IgM ELISA. The deceased case was a 21 years old female. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given.

Cases reported from Village Medhipara, Begarkash, SC Medhipara, Shyamtilla, PHC Jaljali, Kharupetia, District Darrang. District Dindigul. Serum samples were sent to GMCH, Guwahati for further lab investigation and they were found to be positive for Scrub Typhus by ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given.

Malisahi, SC Chandahandi, District presented with samples were collected Nabarangpur. Of education was given.Cases reported from Village Dhodipani, Sahi, Palsapada, Block/CHC Nabarangpur. Cases reported from Village Maring, Block Tamenglong. District investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done.01 Blood sample tested at CMC Koirengei found positive for Scrub Typhus with Rapid Diagnostic Kit. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.Sandangsenba RRT

Cases reported from Village Mohapa, PHC Mohpa, Taluk Kalmeshwar. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Out of 10 serum samples tested at GMC Sentinel center result, 2, found positive for scrub typhus. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given. Deceased was 36 yrs old female suffering with Scrub typhus and H1N1.

Cases reported from Village Khairi Mondha, Block Hingna, PHC Raipur, SC Mondha. Cases presented with symptoms of fever & icterus. The affected age group was 10 to 50 years. Total 8 Serum samples were sent to AIIMS, Nagpur, out of which 1 was positive for scrub typhus IgM by ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral health team on scrub typhus. Active surveillance was done. Cleanliness at animal sheds was done. Spraying of DMP was done. Death of a 37 year old female has occurred due to due to DM with acute Viral Hepatitis with septic shock with AKI (scrub typhus IgM positive).

Cases reported from National Institute of Research in Tribal Health (NIRTH), Jabalpur, CHC Bamhani Banjar, Village: Semarkhapa, Block Bamhnai Banjer. Cases presented with symptoms of fever and black eschar. Five blood/serum samples were sent to AIIMS Bhopal through DPHL Lab Jabalpur, out of which 1 was positive for Scrub Typhus IgM by ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral health team on scrub typhus. Door to door fever survey was done. Insecticide spray was done inside and outside the houses including bushes.

Cases were reported from SS Medical College Rewa, Village: Rausar-Sagara, Sub-District: Huzur, District: Rewa. Cases presented with symptoms of fever with rash. All age groups were affected. Total 35 blood samples were sent to SSMC virology lab, out of which 33 were positive for Scrub Typhus IgM by ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on hygiene and sanitation.

Cases were reported from Sub-District Vijayraghavgarh, District Katni. A 16 year old female died on 21-02-2024 at Medical college, Jabalpur diagnosed as Scrub typhus and leptospirosis. Further fever survey was done. Total 40 blood samples were collected and sent to ICMR, Jabalpur. One sample came positive for Scrub typhus IgM by ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases treated symptomatically. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on vector control measures, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases were reported from Village Padali, Sub- District Pathardi, District Ahmednagar. Cases presented with fever with rash. 2 blood samples were collected and sent to District Hospital, Ahmednagar. Both samples came positive for the Scrub typhus IgM by ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases were treated symptomatically. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on vector control measures, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases reported from Village Bir Bhadson, Sub- District: Indri, District: Karnal. Cases presented with fever. Total 42 samples were collected & sent to DPHL Karnal, out of which 5 were positive for Scrub Typhus IgM by ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on vector control measures, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases reported from Adaka Village, Temasna SC, Bhugaon PHC, Kamptee Block. Cases presented with symptoms of fever, altered sensorium. All age groups were affected. Total 11 samples were collected & sent to AIIMS, Nagpur, out of which 1 was positive for Orientia tsutsugamushi IgM by ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral health team on scrub typhus. Active surveillance was done. Cutting of grasses was done. Malathion powder was sprayed. Death of a 33 year old female has occurred due to the illness (Scrub Typhus positive).

Cases were reported from UPHC Tatoriya, Sub- District: Chhatarpur, District: Chhatarpur. Cases presented with symptoms of fever, vertigo, weakness. One sample tested at Bansal hospital was found to be positive for Scrub Typhus IgM by ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on control measures, hygiene and sanitation. Death of a 60 year old female also a K/C/O DM, HTN, CVD has occurred due to the illness.

Cases reported from Nambiyur Block, E.Chettipalayam PHC,Kadathur HSC, Kadathur Village. Active survey done to find new cases. 7 samples send to Zonal Entomological Team, Coimbatore for analysis; of which 4 tested positive for Scrub Typhus (IgM ELISA) and 3 positive for Chikungunya at IVCZ Hossur. Destructions of rodent burrows done. Pyrethrum spray applied in the scrubs area to kill mites. Fogging and source reduction done.

Outbreak reported from Town area of Pasighat, District East Siang. District RRT alerted, investigation investigated the outbreak. Out of 110 blood smears collected and sent to RMC, ICMR Dibrugarh, 40 samples were positive for Scrub typhus and 4 were positive for Dengue. Active surveillance of cases done. Entomological survey carried out in the affected area. Sufficient stocks of antibiotics maintained.

A total of 242 cases were reported in 32nd week (week ending 12th August, 2012) from Block Pasighat, District East Siang. A total of 270 cases were reported from 13th August to 19th August 2012. 118 samples were collected and sent to RMRC, ICMR-NER, Dibrugarh; 40 serum samples were positive to Scrub typhus. Control measures being undertaken.

Outbreak reported from Village Singbuli, Block Mirik, District Darjeeling. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active search for cases done. Treatment of cases done at PHC Mirik and Kurseong SD Hospital. Doxycycline given to all cases. Out of 35 serum samples collected, 29 were positive for Scrub typhus by Weil Felix. Control measures taken. IEC done.

Outbreak reported from Municipality area Kurseong, Block Kurseong, District Darjeeling. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Treatment of cases done at local health centre and Kurseong SD Hospital. Doxycycline given to all cases. 75 serum samples collected out of which 69 samples were positive for Scrub typhus by Weil Felix. Control measures taken. IEC done.

Outbreak of fever, vomiting, abdominal pain & arthralgia reported from Blocks Viratnagar, Shahpura, Kotputli and Jaipur city, District Jaipur. State/District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. The affected area had poor sanitary conditions. Teams comprising of doctors & paramedical staff deputed in the affected areas. Cases treated locally. Doxycycline given to patients. Out of 36 serum samples collected and tested at SMS Medical College Jaipur, 6 samples were positive for Scrub typhus and 1 sample for Chickungunya. 25 blood smears collected which tested negative for malaria. 8 blood samples collected which tested negative for Dengue (RD kit). Entomological survey done in Village Navrangpura, Block Kotputli indicated: HI 40, BI 70. Anti larval activities and pyrethrum spray done. Distribution of pamphlets done. IEC activities done.

Cases of fever, cough & body ache reported from Villages Doh and Sarkidhar, SC Sarkidhar, PHC Rewalsar, Block Kotli, District Mandi. Block health team investigated the outbreak. Cases treated at medical camp organized in the locality. All 34 blood smears collected were negative for malaria. 10 serum samples collected and sent to Zonal Hospital Mandi which tested positive for Scrub typhus by Weil Felix. IEC done.

Outbreak of fever reported from Villages Maijani, Kiroli, Pawli, Lakhawad, Delun & Gamri, Block Mori, District Uttarkashi. State RRT investigated the outbreak. Active search for cases done by local health staff. Environmental observation showed presence of vegetation, rats and fleas in the affected area. Temporary medical camps established in the community. Symptomatic treatment and Doxycycline given to cases. All 9 blood smears collected tested negative for malaria. Out of 7 serum samples tested at NCDC Delhi, 3 samples were positive for Scrub typhus. IRS and fogging done by District Health Authority. IEC done regarding personal protection, anti rodent measures and sanitation.

Cases reported from Village Dhekiajuli, BPHC Garubandha Ward No-10, Nijarapar Nepalibast Missamari. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey conducted. Serum samples collected and sent to TMCH Sonitpur, result positive. All cases treated. Health education given.

Cases reported from Mahur, Village Kanabasti, PHC Urban Health Centre. District RRT investigated the outbreak. State and District NVBDCP officials were informed. The deceased was 39y/M was negative for Malaria, Japanese Encephalitis, Leptospirosis and Scrub typhus. A total of 03 samples collected and tested at DPHL Dima Hasao, all were found negative for Japanese Encephalitis and 01 positive for Scrub Typhus by IgM ELISA and negative for Dengue, Malaria and Leptospirosis. A single CSF sample was collected and found negative for Japanese Encephalitis. All cases treated. Health education given

Cases reported from Koloriang, Damin, Nyapin, Sarli, Parsi Parlo. District RRT investigated the outbreak. State and District NVBDCP officials were informed. House to house survey conducted. The deceased 7y/M had presented with fever for 2 weeks followed by altered sensorium and loss of consciousness, eschar was present and 16y/M presented with fever and eschar was present. Cases were between 1-18 years of age. A total of 21 samples were collected and all 21 were found positive for Scrub Typhus by IgM using rapid testing kits. All cases treated. Health education given.

Cases reported from Koloriang, Damin, Nyapin, Sarli, Parsi Parlo. District RRT investigated the outbreak. State and District NVBDCP officials were informed. House to house survey conducted. The deceased 7y/M had presented with fever for 2 weeks followed by altered sensorium and loss of consciousness, eschar was present and 16y/M presented with fever and eschar was present. Cases were between 1-18 years of age. A total of 21 samples were collected and all 21 were found positive for Scrub Typhus by IgM using rapid testing kits. All cases treated. Health education given.

Case reported from Village Muthupillaipalayan, PHC Villianur, Sarawanth 1/M, 44, Mariammankoil street. District RRT investigated the outbreak. State and District NVBDCP officials were informed. Case presented with eschar in right axilla. A total of 44 samples were collected and sent to JIPMER, 01 sample was found to be positive for Scrub Typhus by RT PCR. Case treated. Health education given.

Case reported from Village Muthupillaipalayan, PHC Villianur, Sarawanth 1/M, 44, Mariammankoil street. District RRT investigated the outbreak. State and District NVBDCP officials were informed. Case presented with eschar in right axilla. A total of 44 samples were collected and sent to JIPMER, 01 sample was found to be positive for Scrub Typhus by RT PCR. Case treated. Health education given.

Cases reported from Bargi, Deori Barela, Bhedaghat, Patan, Nayagaon, Majholi, Shahpura Bhitoni. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey was conducted. Cases were between 8 and 80 years of age, 06 cases were among men. Lab sample collected and result positive. All cases treated. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Harduakala, CHC Vijayraghavgarh. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey was conducted. The cases were 35y/F and 30y/M. A total of 02 samples were collected and sent to NIRTH, Jabalpur, both samples were found to be positive for Scrub typhus and one sample was found positive for Leptospirosis. All cases treated. Health education given.

Case reported from Village Jaitpuri, SHC Bilaspur, CHC Chandia, Block Karkeli. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey was conducted. The deceased was a 9y/M and had presented with high fever. A single sample was collected and sent to NIRTH, Jabalpur was found to be positive for Scrub typhus and Leptospirosis. Health education given.

Current Status: Cases reported from Koloriang, Damin, Nyapin, Sarli, Parsi

Comments/ Action Taken: Cases reported from several villages. District RRT investigated the outbreak. State and District NVVBDCP officials were informed. House to house survey conducted. The deceased was a 27y/M. Cases presented with high fever, headache and myalgia. Serum samples collected and result awaited. All cases treated. Health education given

Cases reported from several villages. District RRT investigated the outbreak. State and District NVVBDCP officials were informed. House to house survey conducted. The deceased was a 27y/M. Cases presented with high fever, headache and myalgia. Serum samples collected and result awaited. All cases treated. Health education given

Cases reported from Village Shilliang Jashar, CHC Pyursla. Block Pynursla. Both genders are affected with females being affected more (60%). All age groups affected (youngest being 8 years of age and oldest being 50 years of age) The most common symptoms exhibited by all cases are fever of unknown origin. An eschar mark was found in one case. There were two deaths, One 50 year, female with symptoms of fever, chills and nausea who expired on 9/11/2020 and a 11 year old male with symptoms of fever, chills and nausea who expired on 7/11/2020. Rapid Antigen test for COVID-19 were conducted and all were negative. 2 Nasal swabs samples were collected to rule out Influenza and H1N1.13 serum samples were collected by Weil Felix test out of which 8 samples titration level (OXK) were significantly high. RRT investigated the outbreak. An IEC was conducted along with door to door case search and IEC.

Cases reported from Village Paikpari, Saira, Mahisda, Panchberia, Par Alinan. PO Nonakuri Bazar, Saira, Demarihat, Ballukhat, Alinan. Block Sahid Matangini. Cases presented with Fever, Body aches, muscles pain and dark scab. House to house survey done. 15 samples were collected and 5 were reactive. All the rest were negative for scrub typhus and malaria.

Cases reported from Village Vasan, PHC Rupal, Taluka Gandhinagar. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Out of 02 Blood samples tested at a private lab, 1 was positive for Scrub Typhus IgM ELISA. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given. Deceased were 45 year old female and 50 year old male.

Name of District: Shillong, East Khasi Hills, West Khasi Hills & Jaintia Hills
Comments/ Action Taken: Cases reported from areas in Malki Shillong, East Khasi Hills, Nongstoin, West Khasi Hills, Civil Hospital Shillong and Jowai Civil Hospital, Jaintia Hills. All cases are confirmed positive for Weil-Felix test. District Health Authorities informed and alerted to take control measures. IEC activities undertaken.
